list_definition.definition: (often with to) to give attention so as to hear (what someone is saying etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I told her three times, but she wasn’t listening

list_definition.definition: (with to) to follow the advice of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If she’d listened to me, she wouldn’t have got into trouble.

list_ex_of_english: By and large, this course: ...aims to help pupils to develop the four language skills: reading, listening, speaking and writing.
They are given listening or reading tasks that require them to pay attention to the form of the target structure and process its meaning.
He sometimes preached to congregations of some two to three thousand who listened to him with" much attention and willingness".
Seeing is prosaic, listening poetic19 - and 'no colour can ever be as romantic as a tone'.
In this task, the child listened as the experimenter said a pair of words and was asked to report the shared sound.
The children listened to 20 pseudoword items of one syllable, each comprising one to three phonemes.
He listens for the right word like a musician listening for the right note.
Ask the student to create a graphic score of a piece while listening to it.
